revised_title: Effects of X-Rays on Undoped and Hydrogen-Doped Alkaline Earth Fluorides
tldr: The authors investigated the effects of X-rays on undoped and hydrogen-doped alkaline earth fluorides using electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) methods. They found that X-ray irradiation at low temperatures produces centers and trapped electron centers in undoped and hydrogen-doped crystals. The rate of generation of electron centers in hydrogen-doped crystals is greater than in undoped crystals. The study provides insights into the production of defects in alkaline earth fluorides and the behavior of trapped electron centers.
